intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Well, this should be interesting. I've never sailed before. And we made it just in time to catch the last boat leaving the harbor. How lucky!

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: I know. It's been such a long march—I'm really looking forward to r-resting a bit.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: I wouldn't get too comfortable. Remember, we are on our way to Nohr. Some of the passengers on this ship could be our enemies.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Yes, and there could be a spy among us.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: What are you talking about, Takumi?

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: You know exactly what I'm talking about. That whiny little mage from Nohr! Whose idea was it to let him tag along?

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Gah! I'm no threat, guys! I promise! Haven't I been helpful so far?

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: Don't worry, Takumi. I've been keeping a very close eye on him.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: I don't know. Didn't he set everyone up back in Izumo? I wouldn't be surprised if he were plotting something.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: But...but...

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: OK, I'll get my knife ready...

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Eeeek!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Calm down, everyone. I trust Zola, and I believe you should as well. He stood with us through one battle without stabbing anyone in the back. Besides, how could he even really information to Nohr? It's a preposterous notion.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Sorry. I can't just take your word for it. I don't trust him.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: That's fine. A little healthy skepticism won't hurt. Just try to be civil, OK?

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: I'll do my best.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Lord Takumi...

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: What's wrong with you? Did I say that you could speak my name?

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Gah! No, sir. I'm sorry, sir.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Well, petty disagreements aside, we've had smooth sailing so far, don't you agree? The captain even says we could reach Nohr tomorrow with favorable winds.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: That's great news. Although, to be honest, I wouldn't mind a longer trip. It's so relaxing out here.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: N-not for me. I've been feeling a little seasick, to be honest. But it looks like you've really taken to the sea. You've been out here for hours!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Perhaps when all of this is over, I'll buy my own boat... Although...it does appear that the weather is turning on us.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Oh! You're right. Those clouds don't look good. And look at the w-waves!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Right. Let's head inside before we get soaked!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Whoa. It's really roughs out there.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Ahhhh! We've stopped moving! How is that even possible? Are you OK, Corrin?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Yeah, I'm fine. But we really need to get out of here! Maybe there's a problem with the boat. Let's go speak with the captain.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I've never seen a storm come on this quickly. Is this normal at sea?

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: I don't think so. I'm s-scared, Corrin. My goodness! Look at the sea! Those waves are massive! This boat is too big to capsize, right? Right?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Stand back! There's something in the water!

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Eeeek!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What is it?
Shh...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Who goes there? Are...are you the spirit who appeared when my mother was killed?
Shh...

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Corrin! What's going on?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Stay back, Azura!

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Milady! Are you OK?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Yes, I'm fine. Thank you, Kaze!

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Lord/Lady Corrin! What is that thing?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Your guess is as good as mine. A storm came out of nowhere, and then this spirit appeared on deck.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Maybe it came out of the water...

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Well, it looks like we have a fight on our hands. Whatever this spirit is, it seems capable of sinking our ship!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: We've come too far for that. Everyone, on guard!

battle.speaker: Reina
battle.line: Ah, at last. I can see Lord/Lady Corrin from here. Oh my. Look at them struggling with those spirits. Well, I should be able to help them with that! May my bow strike true and deliver exquisite pain and death upon my enemies!

recruit-talk.speaker: Reina
recruit-talk.line: Hello, Lord/Lady Corrin. I'm glad you're safe and sound.

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: I'm sorry, but who are you? And do you realize that we're in the middle of a battle?

recruit-talk.speaker: Reina
recruit-talk.line: Oh, yes, of course. But this type of battle is like a playground to me. I'm Reina, a kinshi knight from Hoshido. Yukimura sent me here to provide you with my special brand of assistance. Specifically, skewering enemies by the dozen. Oh, I wish you could have seen some of the work I did on the way here. The depth of agony was palpable. And the palette of violent reds...so vivid. Mmm...

recruit-talk.speaker: Reina
recruit-talk.line: I'm talking about the enemies I killed on the way here.

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Ah. I see. And you're not going to kill any of us, right? Just our enemies?

recruit-talk.speaker: Reina
recruit-talk.line: Of course! I'm sorry if you misunderstood. Please, just point me in the direction of anything you would like to die.

recruit-talk.speaker: Corrin
recruit-talk.line: Right. Well, anyone glowing purple would be a good start...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: That's the last of them.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Ha! Those stupid things didn't know who they were messing with.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Well, I'm glad to see that you're feeling like yourself again. Takumi.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Me too. After all, I have a long way to go to redeem myself...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Takumi, that's simply not true.
Shh...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Look out!

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Hmm?

end.speaker: Zola
end.line: Lord Takumi! Move!

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: He saved me!

end.speaker: Zola
end.line: Ugh...now's your chance. Take him out!

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: With pleasure. Haaaa!
Ugh...

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: That did it.

end.speaker: Zola
end.line: Well done...Lord...Takumi... Oh...I forgot. I'm not supposed to say your name... *cough* *cough*

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Oh. About that...

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: Zola! Are you OK? Took quite a shot there. Here, I can help heal your wounds.

end.speaker: Zola
end.line: Thank you, milady...

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Hmm.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: That was extremely courageous, Zola. Are you all right?

end.speaker: Zola
end.line: It was nothing. I'm just glad that Lady Sakura was able to heal me.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I beg to differ. It was not nothing. It was a remarkably selfless act.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Zola...I have something to say to you.

end.speaker: Zola
end.line: Yes, Lord Tak—I mean yes, milord?

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Please. You've more than earned the right to speak my name. I'm sorry for doubting you.

end.speaker: Zola
end.line: Really? You mean that?

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Yes. Talk is cheap, and I still think I was smart not to trust you at first. But you may have just saved my life. It was a heroic act.

end.speaker: Zola
end.line: Thank you, Lord Takumi! I'm just following Lord/Lady Corrin's lead. If it weren't for him/her, I may have died at the hands of Lord Leo in Izumo. Now maybe you'll have the chance to perform a similar gesture.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Wait, Corrin jumped in front of an attack meant for you? Right after you tried to kill him/her?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Ha! No, Takumi. It wasn't exactly like that. I merely asked Leo to spare Zola's life. He was helpless and defeated.

end.speaker: Zola
end.line: Yes. And that kindness was enough to sway Lord Leo. He merely exiled me instead of taking my life.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: I see. Well, I just hope we can put all of this behind us.

end.speaker: Zola
end.line: Of course, milord!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes. It's time to focus on what's next. Who knows what's waiting for us in Nohr...
